radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Color Doppler ultrasonography of the abdomen
radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild splenic enlargement, spleen measuring 14.3 cm in length; liver normal in size and echotexture; patent liver vasculature with normal flow pattern; no free fluid in the abdomen.
Grade I varices in the lower third of the esophagus; results otherwise normal.
Established cirrhosis characterized by diffuse bridging fibrosis and nodularity; mild mononuclear septal inflammation; focal macrovesicular steatosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Histochemical staining for copper showed extensive copper deposition in hepatocytes at the edge of cirrhotic nodules, consistent with Wilson's disease.
